utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- other than political, what would be your best category?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Music. I would think music. I would also say compassion. If they have a topic called compassion, I would probably get every question right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Daily Double?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Because you would pick the opposite of what you would do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There is love

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, what do you think would be your best category?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did have -- I had an opportunity to be on it, I lost. It was the most --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You lost at Jeopardy?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who beat you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: David Farber of CNBC --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You lost to CNBC?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and I were close. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait, did Kareem beat you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think so. I was leading going into the commercial break and I totally fell apart.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was the most nervous I have ever been in my entire life.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think the category I would do well in would be like country music, for one, or like if there's Garth Brooks category, I might get that. Also, I would be pretty good on '80s movies.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Eighties movies, that's a great category.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think I'm good on that too. That's what we did very well in charades together.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, we did. That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That movie is for people in their 80s? Like "On Golden Pond"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Close -- also a movie from the '80s.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is, wasn't it -- ladies for the 80's Jack.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: KG, what would be our category at Jeopardy, not political? Food?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Pepperoni?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have a specialty in pepperoni.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's all you need (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That frequently comes up on the show. Yes, food probably be pretty good. I'd say I would dominate --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Fashion.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Fashion I would be great at. American political history, but that kind of involves politics.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We got to play within the lines, KG.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What else? Law? Well law, can I have that or is that just too obvious?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, I think we're going to allow law. Judges, we're allowing law. Juan, what would be yours? We can actually give you politics because let's be honest, you don't know that much.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The thing is, I know enough to get the answers. But I would say, historical figures, if you could do that, is that political?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, that's good, historical figures.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you could do historical figures or you could do like --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That involves politics, too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You think that's politics?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: not all historical figures are political.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Judges, we're going to allow it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I would like to compete in the, like the high school Jeopardy. I really want to beat those high school kids. I could compete on that level.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's how you are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That makes me feel good. Stay right there. We're going to be back with our final July Fourth thoughts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Now some final thoughts on this Independence Day. We had a lot of questions from our fans. I enjoyed it. Everybody?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes we did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. Are we ready to eat some of these ribs?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I am. Let's start eating.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And thanks to Dinosaur Barbecue. It's delicious, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, thank Dinosaur. That's it for us. We'll see you back here tomorrow. Have a great rest of your holiday. "Hannity" is up next. utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello everyone and Happy Birthday America. I'm Dana Perino along with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 9 o'clock in New York City and this is "The Five." Welcome to our July 4th Special. Thanks for joining us tonight. We have a very fun show in-store. So, make sure to stay with us throughout the hour. Before we begin, we would like to give a very special salute to our troops and to our vets this Independence Day. We thank you for our freedom. Tonight, we are doing something we have never done before. We are answering your questions for the entire hour. Some are serious. Some are silly. All of them are great. You posted most of them on our Facebook page and we've got them right here. So, I am going to begin -- first question is going to go to Kimberly. This is from Robin K. She wants to know, which do you like better, watching a fireworks display, lighting your own fireworks, both, or none?

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: How about watching a fireworks display.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're not like a pyromaniac.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No. And when I was a camp fire girl, you know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Like yourself. Like yourself.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: And me. I don't talk about it, though.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We accept everyone. I didn't ever liked to light matches or do anything like that. I never did until I was in college.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You never lit a match until college? That is insane! That is insane!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But also --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What is wrong with matches? Have you ever had a birthday cake?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: You don't play with as a child, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't call matches a toy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And I was also never a smoker. There was really no need.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, you had no need for one of the greatest inventions ever.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. And I also catch on fire a lot, that is a problem. Three times so far.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It must have been the hairspray. It leads to my hair catching on fire, literally, three times.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Got to be careful then.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Exactly. So, stay away from matches.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What about -- would you, I know you live in the city so you probably watch fireworks, but would you prefer to like them if you could?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would prefer that I would like them because watching something with other people bores me. I don't want to share my pleasure with other people. I prefer to light my own --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The feeling is mutual.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I prefer to be in a garage lighting these little snakes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, I love snakes. We put them on bricks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Somehow, I identify with them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do they still have those?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I probably wouldn't be allowed to play with you as a child.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't go over to Gutfeld's house. That kid is troubled.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That still holds true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you light fireworks for your children?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not for my children. I tried to keep them inside when I do the fireworks. Because again that is dangerous. But we used to have Roman candles back in the day, where you shoot the Roman candles at each other.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is not a good idea. Do not try this at home.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Jesse still has the same common sense approach.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, what is your tradition? Do you like to go to a fireworks display?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes. I love fireworks. In fact, I made a big deal out of it. I mean, I don't know, I remember recently I was on the roof of the Canadian Embassy, right there on constitution, you know?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And watching the fireworks, I like now sometimes --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How American of you. I'm just kidding. I mean, it's a great spot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It is a great spot. But you know, if you go there by the capital, you can hear all the music. I have been in Boston for Boston pops on the Fourth of July, right there on the river, that is pretty cool. In fact, the nice thing about that as you get so many people on either side of the river bank, is spectacular celebration.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When we were kids, mostly, we would be in New Castle, Wyoming at my grandpa's ranch for the Fourth of July, so my uncle would handle the fireworks, but often there was also a drought. So, we couldn't do much.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what's the difference --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That would start a forest fire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't be that person.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, it is such a difference between urban celebrations and rural celebrations. Like for example, I remember the first time I drove south and got to south of the border. Have you ever been there?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Holy smokes! They'll gave you anything --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No pun intended. I am telling you. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's actually a good point because the best memories about Fourth of July are trying to find a legal -- we would always go to Chinatown and San Francisco to buy our firecrackers and there's always some kid in school, some kid that was a little bit older, perhaps a little bit - - anyway. He would sell barrel bombs.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And then, the guy that stole the other stuff when you were in high school.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He was a capitalist in fifth grade.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Would you call them barrel bombs --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Bombs. M80s.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, in Brooklyn they would call them trash cans. And it would just -- boom!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cherry bombs.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, man.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I didn't like that. Kimberly and I didn't do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, you can't light up fireworks in Brooklyn or because everyone is going to think it is not fireworks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, but these days --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And also, to keep them after, the Fire Department will come to your house if you start the fireworks.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't even like those things that snaps?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes. That is fake, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, the party favors you get? You know what is the best thing about Fourth of July is the smell of wet fireworks in a bucket? It is -- or just smells great. If they can turn that into a pizza topping, I would eat it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, you know what comes to my mind? Is, if you are driving home, both in New York City, but also, Washington, D.C. where I live now, after the fireworks, you come to some neighborhoods and it looks like it is just smoke-filled. You think -- and you realize, there are people in the streets putting up so many fireworks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is weed, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. I can smell the difference between weed and fireworks. This is fireworks.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, this is a question that, Greg and I are not going to answer it because we do not have children. So, it's going to be these three, we'll start with you Jesse, from Rachel L, do you have any traditions that you have done since you were a child that you have passed down to your children?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, God! That's a good one. Not fireworks. I think that is little too dangerous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do they wear the collars up?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, that is a tradition that everybody wants stopped.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We cut that out. Gosh, what do we do? What did I pass on? My sister, for Christmas, makes this really good cake. And I think she calls it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Cake.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What is it called? It's called -- I don't even think I can say it on TV. Icebox cake.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And yes, she makes that and it is very easy to make.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: On the Fourth of July?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What's that like?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, it's not on the Fourth of July.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've never heard of it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I am assuming it's a Fourth of July.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh! Wow!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse, Jesse, turn around, behind you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What day is it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fourth of July.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I don't have any fourth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. How about you, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, I think fireworks are pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And I really like making a big deal about where we're going to watch fireworks tonight. You try to get the best view in Washington because it is a spectacular display.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Also, New York City. Now, I have never seen this but everyone tells me, it is the biggest in the nation, right on the river here in New York.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Always the big show. Kimberly, how about you?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Two nights on Fourth of July parades out in the Hamptons like Sag Harbor in Southamptons are really nice, everybody loves to see.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Tough one, AG.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did we do the crosshair?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And I believe I gave the same answer, wonderfully consistent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I want to weigh in here about something that I hate about July 4th. Why does it have to be on the fourth? Why not just designate the first Monday of July so we can have a three-day weekend instead, we all going to come back and work on Monday, and then we get Tuesday off. Why don't we do like they do with Thanksgiving which is always, what it is, Thursday?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. But the Fourth of July really isn't about you having a day off. It's about celebrating the founding of the nation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is. No, that is how I celebrate the founding of a nation with a three-day weekend. But, you know, you have to go back to work on Monday. Just make it the first Monday of July, no matter what.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And while we are at it, can we do that Monday after the Super Bowl, also?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what? One of my favorites Fourth of July, was the night before Fourth of July, when my kids were pretty young, we went to see the movie "Independence Day." Have you ever seen that movie, where the aliens are attacking Americans, the jets, and we are fighting, and we are beating the aliens? And so, we, by the time the movie was over, it was after midnight, and the little guys are like, you know, bug-eyed because they are overtired. It was like, for me, one of the most spectacular independent states --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love how lovely and sentimental you are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We had a tradition at my house growing up on July 3rd, it was called July 3rd eve. We would all wait for -- I think it was called fireworks clause to come down the chimney and deliver our fireworks.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Is this made up?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, you're going to help us keep this going. Because question three is from Kat P. She wants to know for you preference, beach or mountain vacation? What do you prefer?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Guys?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, really? We have to answer this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Is a mountain camping?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, you could be in a hotel in the mountain?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Where?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like Deer Valley.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is there a spa in the mountain?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. It is definitely going to be beach.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That is where I get engaged the most. Yes. Beaches.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Are we looking for that this year?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Beach vacation plan.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Beach vacation. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Okay. Good. Good. Juan, beach or mountains?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh my God!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're going to vote, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I do occasionally, but I mean, there is no question, the water just cools me, and I love water.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You really do need to --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You like tropical vacations.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I love tropical vacations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Have you been camping, Juan, ever, in your life?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, this is a funny question, Jesse. Because after I got married and there's a point of contention with my wife to this day. She says we went to the Poconos. And I always think, why do you say that to people? It sounds like I'm such a, you know -- but anyway, we actually did go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You honeymooned in the Poconos?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, we just got married and went to see my parents in Brooklyn. But the funny part of this is, so we made arrangements to go camping in the Poconos.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, I go up there and the guy says, well, where is your camping equipment? And I thought being a city boy, oh, don't you provide the equipment? I didn't think I was coming, a knapsack and equipment. So, we ended up --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Knapsack.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We ended up in a hotel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We would vacation well together.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I like it because bugs don't bother you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Have you ever been on a vacation with like big bugs?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How about you Greg, do you like beaches or mountains?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like to combine. I sometimes will camp on the beach.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sometimes, I'll go to the mountains wearing nothing but a speedo and I will crawl into a hollowed out log and cry silently until somebody sends help.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you do that on Sixth Avenue.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is why I don't go camping.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just like to hike with very little on. I have a walking stick and a speedo and I search for tadpoles.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let me know if you run into Hillary.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. This is going to be -- this is a tough question for me to answer. So, I'm not going to go first. We'll start with Jesse. Alan G wants to know, if you were stranded on a desert island and could choose one album or CD, what would it be?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not country, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sorry to disappoint.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's okay. That's okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's see. Let's see. Probably greatest hits from the '80s. Do they have something like that? 80s hits.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sure. Okay. 80s hit. Yes, of course you could.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can go with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute. You're a young guy? 80s hits?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What do you want, 90s?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, I just thought it would be like, you know, 2,000s.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, I think that matches his personality profile actually. Are you going to like Lionel Richie?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I like Lionel Richie but no, I think I would pick Bob Marley.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hmm.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: On an island.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: On an island, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey, hey.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Abba.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: "Dancing Queen."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, fantastic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Obviously, you have a good answer for this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, basically, the question says, what is your favorite album? Every day does their desert island kind of thing, it's like, that weighs a lot of time, just say, what is your favorite album?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, what is your favorite album?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Yes. I would say "Songs the Lord Taught Us" by The Cramps. One of the greatest albums of all time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I got to go listen now because you really know music.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Psycho rockabilly. It's fantastic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I think the heart of this question Greg is, something you wouldn't get tired of listening to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I play that album every day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Come on!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're making it up. Right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Well, this has been a great start to our Facebook Friday holiday type of thing. All right. Coming up, we'll answer the best political questions you guys sent in. There are some really good ones. So, stay with us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to our Facebook Fourth of July special. We are answering your questions. And we will going to answer them throughout the hour. They came from you. So, stay with us. Let's take a look at some of the best political questions that you sent. Number one, if you could have been Vice President to any American president, who would you choose? KG.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, Ronald Reagan!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thank you for coming to me first. Juan has to make up another answer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That would have been taken.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what, let me just tell you, so if you had been in a press conference with Ronald Reagan --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You would have been the first person called upon because you are in a red dress and he had a weakness for red dresses.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There is your trivia for the night. If I had better timing I could go back in a time machine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: A time machine. Well, you know, he loved Nancy but I am sure he would have been fascinated. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Juan. I would be the vice president for Martin Van Buren.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. Explain.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm sure you would have been quite a character in that period.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'm quite a character now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That is true. I didn't mean anything by it. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Full time character.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What about you, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would have to say George Washington.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Now, why is that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because I have always loved him. And I would have liked to have gotten to know him. I mean, history, perhaps, portrays him as something greater even than he was in person but I do think that he was quite a remarkable person. I would have loved to have helped.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Father of our nation. Gregory?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Richard Nixon. Just because no one would --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A chance of getting to be president?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Exactly. And I'll tell you, he wouldn't expect much of me. I would step in, kind of hang out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. He's not Nixon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Be there with a walking stick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. I would change the world and I would have prevented a President Carter.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: From being re-elected. There would have been no Carter. The American rebirth would have happened sooner.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is a shock.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Then, there wouldn't have been a Ronald Reagan because I would have been so great. I would have been elected for a third term.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, you could have been agno, you know?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. You could have been agno and then you would have been gone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That could have been the alternative.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What about you, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, I think, I was thinking about this and for the Democrats, you know, I think FDR, obviously, is to my mind, the game changer in terms of presidents who, Democratic presidents who made history. But I also think it would have been fun to be Bill Clinton or Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. It would have been fun to be Bill.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because Al Gore got so angry at him for his screw-ups. And Al Gore feels like he got ripped off by the President. So, if Al Gore had been able to prevent Bill Clinton, boy, what a different track we would have been as a country.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. Question number two, we will going to go the other way this time. If the founding fathers came back today, Gregory, what do you think their opinion would be of our current government situation?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think they would say, hey, this is working out pretty well. I mean, it's 241 years. I bet -- maybe it goes ten, 20 years. Holy damn. And it's like, and then it will be like the Second Amendment, working out pretty well for everybody. We weren't sure that everybody but now this place is great because they can protect each other, and everybody respects each other, kind of, because of the Second Amendment. And the First Amendment is still around. They are going like, dude, we did pretty well! And they high five and they wouldn't even know how to high five but they feel the urge to high five just because they did such a great job. And then, we would go out, we go bar hopping and I would pay for all their drinks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, that was a lot of drinking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a lot of ale.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: A lot of stream of consciousness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would give them powder for their legs. Among other things.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Introduce them to a couple of chicks in Times Square.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: This is an awesome segment.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dana --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that the question kind of leads you to think, would they be disappointed because we are at each other's throats? But actually, way back when, they actually were at each other's throats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, I think that they would think, wow, and I agree that 241 years, like you can't really conceive of that now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What the world would look like. So, I think if they thought it was still standing, that we were the best country that the world that ever known --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And it's because of them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's because of them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is brilliant.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And they were very young. You look back and you think, because they had the powdered wigs, they looked older. But honestly at 35 or so, that they had such wisdom. I think that is amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You had that wisdom at 35 --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're going to die.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Your lifespan was pretty short.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I don't have anything really that provocative didn't really say like Greg or that interesting like Dana. I mean, they probably watch TV. They'd probably like to play video games. You know, I don't know. Maybe shoot an AR-15. I don't really think they would think about it too much.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't think they would think about it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I think, you know, we did a nice job, the fake news media is still running wild. And that is about it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would say, they'd be a little bit surprised to be honest about the way things are.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But I would think they would be quite excited that the constitution and everything has held up as it has.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I agree. And that is what Greg said too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, I think that that would really be the headline of it. Probably surprises some of the things that have gone on in the world.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But also because the idea of the country was founded on that God provides inalienable rights to all of us and that America has held true to that and that we have not gone after countries for, we've not started wars where we are trying to get other people's blood and treasure, we are actually just trying to provide liberty, and I think that they would be proud of that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: A beacon of democracy. I would agree. And this is going to be able to -- but I wrote a book on this very topic and I came to the same conclusion that Greg and Kimberly did, which is that they would be stunned that it still exists. There constitution that it has not been messed with. We have amendments. But they built in. That structured allowing for some flexibility. But I gave a little talk in which I say, you know, if they showed up right here on Sixth Avenue, they say, hey, what is all these surveillance? What are these cameras on the street lights? How can you guys let the government --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How about the IRS? They wouldn't be happy about the IRS.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think that they're more worried about getting hit by a taxi.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, it might be on Sixth Avenue. They wouldn't be happy with the -- they would think that we have too much military. And, you know, why do we have troops overseas permanently? They would not be happy with that. They have lots of gay marriage, a woman running for president?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you can't judge them about gay marriage back in the 1776.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And developments over time and they would have to respond --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. But that is the genius of the constitution of the founding fathers.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Directly ahead, if you are not hungry now, baby, you will be soon. Kimberly is going to lead us through the best Fourth of July food options. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: MARIANNE RAFFERTY, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: This is a FOX News alert. I'm Marianne Rafferty in Los Angeles. A show of force by the U.S. and South Korea in direct response to that latest missile launch by North Korea. The U.S. Eighth Army in South Korean unit firing deep strikes precision missiles into South Korean territory on waters. The missile firings intended to demonstrate US/South Korean solidarity. The U.S. now confirming North Korea did launch an intercontinental ballistic missile earlier today, and that missile has a potential of hitting Alaska. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson saying it represents a new escalation of the global threat posed by North Korea. Tillerson also saying, the U.S. will never accept a new nuclear armed North Korea. U.S. ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley will raise U.S. concerns at an emergency meeting at the U.N. Security Council tomorrow. I am Marianne Rafferty. Now, back to "The Five", Fourth of July Special.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. And Happy Fourth of July. The holiday best known for flag, fireworks and of course, food, my favorite. Let's take a look at the top food questions that we have received on Facebook.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Hmm.

utterances.utterance: Hmm.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's true!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What is your drink of choice? Meaning, alcohol.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, first of all, you know, Fourth of July is everyday somewhere. So you should be able to eat like this every day. And that's what I do. I always have ribs. I always have barbecue and food. That's all I eat every day and I am pretty low cholesterol for now. My favorite drink is --

utterances.utterance: Yes. I know what it is.

utterances.utterance: That's your number one.

utterances.utterance: -- good for your heart. But when I'm feeling in a tropical mood I would have a Dark and Stormy --

utterances.utterance: Those are good, aren't they?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- with Gosling rum, ginger beer, angostura bitters and just a slice of lime. I make an excellent version.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would love to try one of those. I recently just tried one --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I happen to be free later, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd love to make you a Dark and Stormy. We'll have a Dark and night.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: For me it would be.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.utterance: Well, so in the summertime, my friend Ingrid has made me -- she drinks this concoction of ros,, like a sparkling water, ice, and she makes a really tall glass. And so, she calls it summer water.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She doesn't blend it like the --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. I am dying to try.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's called cheap wine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm trying to, well, it's not cheap really what she makes, you know, that

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But she's watering down ros,.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes because that way you can drink --

utterances.utterance: More.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They do that in bars.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- if you have a problem. It's illegal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Guys, that's the same thing as like a white wine spritzer.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's just like that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's like a ros, spritzer.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, that's my drink of choice this summer. But I'm dying to try that fros,, so maybe one night we can go do that after the show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Summer water sounds like the name of a stripper.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: In the name of my drink. What a coincidence.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Really? This is a family celebration. OK, Jesse, maybe you can -- probably not. All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, no wait --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Favorite alcohol? I like it all. I really like Moscow Mule, that's my drink of choice. It has been my drink of choice for the last two years straight, but I'm still going strong.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: In the summer and winter?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I don't discriminate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't like that they put it in a solid --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Copper cups.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Copper cup.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: See, I like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's the whole point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's in your mind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You might have to get a better cup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I need a clear glass for your drink. You don't put it in a solid -- it's bad.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But then it's not a Moscow Mule.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can do whatever you want.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- it's got vodka, lime. So, one time on Amazon I saw they had those cups for sale, and I wanted to make this at home.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But then nothing else happens.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So you buy them?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, I have to get the other ingredients.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like the idea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, talk to William Devane. He can get you copper at a great price.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I love him. Oh my god. He's the best, isn't he? OK, Juanito.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.utterance: Yes, and there are all kinds of reserves. There' like, well, I won't get into it because it is advertising, but they're just wonderful tequilas. But the thing about it, lately, if I'm going out to dinner, I'll have like a Martini, you know, and that's pretty good. I like Grey Goose, Belvedere and those kind of things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You also like really like beer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but I today is Fourth of July show guys and beer is like the official alcohol of the Fourth of July. And everybody at a picnic is going over the cooler and grabbing a cold one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, I'm trying to see one more for this. I like tequila too. Casamigos and (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like after the show because it's like late.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Which are like now every day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The problem is I like ice cream.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You do like ice cream.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not a problem, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is for somebody.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What about DP?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This one time we were at one of the conventions, I had to work really late and then afterwards one of our colleagues said, would you like to go for a drink afterwards? So I said, sure. But I had to wait so long to join her and then they were bringing alcohol and I thought, I really need to eat or else, you know, I'll get sick. But when they brought the food over, the menu and a platter, she said, "Oh, no thanks. We work in television. We don't eat after midnight."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh no, she embarrassed --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I was like, oh, right, we don't eat after midnight, right. But I was so hungry.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You were so hungry.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sometimes, I'll have a cup of yogurt before bed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Is that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, I knew it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm so good. All right, secret.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I go for the spiciest late-night food I can find because it gives you amazing dreams. Do you ever go to bed after eating spicy food? You can actually have lucid dreams that are mind-blowing. Just incredible. You don't even need VR with spicy food. It's a Thai food. That will do the trick.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: VR?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Virtual reality.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Past summer, I like to make one of my highly acclaimed and delicious pepperoni quesadillas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, wait.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, 20 seconds in the microwave. You put a little tortilla, a piece of cheddar cheese and then you make a little (INAUDIBLE) pepperoni and snack on it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is that Ronan's favorite?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: People love it. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love it. I feel like one right now. When we return, it's a wild card round led by Greg. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to our Fourth of July special where we're answering the questions you sent in on Facebook. The category for this round of questions, potpourri, a word I don't like because the T is silent.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why is that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I have no idea, but it should be --.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: T's are -- they shouldn't be silent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There should be --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- because T is a strong letter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There has to be a pot dispensary called potpourri somewhere. I would imagine. All right, first question, let's start with you, Dana. From Edana F., "If you had to spend 100 days on an island without any technology and you take one person with you who is not a spouse or relative, who would it be and why?" And you can already take your pets, so don't worry about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would take my sister, Angie. She is a lot of good fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But she's not -- she's not a relative?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, so no relatives? All right, I'll take Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm not a company. (ph)

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She's great company. She's funny. She can make a pepperoni quesadilla.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's no microwave, no technology! Listen to the questions people!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She doesn't even know how to use a match s she's not making a fire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look, let me give you the --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I never knew how to open a bottle of wine either, but there seems to be people around that likes to help me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let me give you the answer. It's Mike Rowe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, like if you mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Could we just skip this question?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why are you so jealous? You don't like the cheap --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's Mike Rowe. He's somebody who could survive.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I guess if its survival is the thing, you want the Rock or somebody like that. You could really --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's an actor.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't think he's really strong?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who won "Survivor"? Pick that person.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- to do stuff. You think of rescue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Somebody's got to chop wood and then design --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, Elisabeth Hasselbeck. She was on "Survivor."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go with that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kill two birds with one stone

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't even know what that means.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And she's very sweet and she would pray for you too for safety.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I guess I would choose like -- no, I'd have to choose somebody that -- because I have no technical --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No skills.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- no labor skills.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you could really write a good essay about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what, I would bring an optometrist. I'd bring an optometrist. If my glasses broke and I am on an island, I am screwed. So I would have an optometrist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He doesn't have any machines.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He would build one. If he's worth his salt, optometrist on an island.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You bring Ben Franklin. Ben Franklin, Fourth of July. Bring Ben Franklin.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- re-read the same book over and over again?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did you -- that would be fun. Did you pick somebody?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You would be perfect like the Tom Hanks guy. Did I pick somebody?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A volleyball head?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would probably -- I don't know exactly. I would probably pick an entertaining man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. I know where you're going with it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Stop picking on me, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's Fourth of July.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't help it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's upset because he wanted someone to choose him. That's the thing. He's upset because Dana chose me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I actually going to choose Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is an interesting question. I'm starting with you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is from Maureen T., "If you had the ability to perceive the future in one year, would you rather see your future or someone else's, and if it's someone else, who would that person be?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, obviously my own future.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Don't be so selfish.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, come on, everybody is scared (ph), and it would help other people too to know what I'm doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, what if you're not there? Would that creep you out?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, then that's the exact part. Thanks for that dark premonition. Are you planning anything?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's why you're not coming on my island.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- roast me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You could make a pepperoni quesadilla in the sun because it's warm enough and it would melt the cheese.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are we still talking about the island?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know but I'm just thinking. It wouldn't have to be that hot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, to see the future, you are somebody you know?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, can you change the future?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, you can just see it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's not over think this Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) said you can only see it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You can only see it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, obviously I have children, so, I'd love to know that they're OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. See, that's a nice answer. Kimberly?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know if it was nice but it was honest.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly is busy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What would you --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's Fourth of July. You're supposed to be celebrating.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, who would you rather -- would you rather see your future or someone else's in a year?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I probably like to see someone else's future.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Anybody in particular?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. No, I can already predict that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe my sons. That will be nice to know, you know, you want to know if he'll be okay and everything.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like champion soccer player.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Lacrosse or something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Did I not answer it earlier?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think, no, I went to Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't want to see my future.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I just trust.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't want to see my future, you know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you whose future I want to see, Bashar al-Assad. Does he stay or go?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That could be depressing if the answer is he's staying around.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well at least we'd know then what to do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't care with seeing my future. It probably wouldn't be very exciting. I'll just be sitting here doing Facebook questions.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And on that note, and it was an upbeat note, America, because I'm here for you. Ahead, we select the next round of questions specifically for the randomness. Things will get interesting after this quick break.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Happy Fourth of July. Continuing now with answers to the questions you sent in through Facebook. The next category, more random ones.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, my first question is from Scott w. and this goes to Dana Perino.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "If you could put one person on a rocket to Mars, who would it be and why?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Don't answer that --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it can't be me. Oh, you beat me to it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it can't be Bashar al-Assad

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One person to Mars, well, I think I would send my brother-in-law, Ben, because he loves space so much and he is so into it and very interested. I'm assuming they get to go and look around and come back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So you assumed that, that was not assumed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's one way. Nice try.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I didn't assume that. I think it's (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg Gutfeld, who would you send?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Somebody extremely old.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, how about the guy, no, what about the guy (INAUDIBLE)?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because if they --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's a lawyer. I would say, yes, somebody old in case they don't come back. So they've had a full life.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You are dark. There's a dark thing (ph) in you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, because if you go to Mars right now, you're not coming back. So, it's some guy's who's had a full life.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would send a baby. KG?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would send Kim.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kim Kardashian?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, Kim Jong-Un.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK. Got it. Or Kim Kardashian, just kidding. I love you. Juan, what do you got.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Who would I send to Mars?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I have no idea. You think Trump's available?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You put a big (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Martians, you all owe me $20. You're in big trouble.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: "Make Mars Great Again."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: "Make Mars Great Aain."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, next question. From Susan N., Kimberly Guilfoyle, "What other professional worker would you like to shadow for a day or two to see another side of life? A nurse, a police officer, a factory worker or someone not in the media? What person would you shadow?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know, for her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just for a day or two.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think you would like to go and be like with a surgeon because you love science.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I do, I love medicine. That would be very good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, who would you shadow for a day?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, you mean like, you know, just a fascination, I'd go watch like a baseball player or a pro basketball player and see how they do it, and how they stay in shape. It would be fascinating to me. But that's the fan part of me. But I think intellectually, I would love to see an architect at work because now they use these computers and they have all these --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You have to do CADD drawing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's amazing stuff.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Fascinating, Juan. Sounds like a blast. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would go if they would let me, with an undercover CIA agent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think you're allowed to do that? Is that on the list?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is Facebook questions.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't announce that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Dana is like an "zero dark thirty" kind of --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You would stick out like a sore thumb on a CIA ops (INAUDIBLE). Gutfeld, who would you shadow?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would shadow any kind of generic data processor because I would just sit there most of the time and I wouldn't have to really go anywhere. I could probably just kind of like play with my phone until it's over.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That is so weird, something like robot oriented.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm sure the person who would be thrilled to have you sit on your phone. Gutfeld comes through again. All right, Sherry C., this is going to go right back to Gutfeld, "If you were a contestant on Jeopardy -- have you been a contestant --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Dana was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Never.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- other than political, what would be your best category?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Music. I would think music. I would also say compassion. If they have a topic called compassion, I would probably get every question right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Daily Double?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Because you would pick the opposite of what you would do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is love

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, what do you think would be your best category?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I did have -- I had an opportunity to be on it, I lost. It was the most --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You lost at Jeopardy?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who beat you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: David Farber of CNBC --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You lost to CNBC?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and I were close. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait, wait, did Kareem beat you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think so. I was leading going into the commercial break and I totally fell apart.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It was the most nervous I have ever been in my entire life.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think the category I would do well in would be like country music, for one, or like if there's Garth Brooks category, I might get that. Also, I would be pretty good on '80s movies.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Eighties movies, that's a great category.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think I'm good on that too. That's what we did very well in charades together.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, we did. That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That movie is for people in their 80s? Like "On Golden Pond"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Close -- also a movie from the '80s.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is, wasn't it -- ladies for the 80's Jack.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: KG, what would be our category at Jeopardy, not political? Food?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Pepperoni?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have a specialty in pepperoni.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's all you need (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That frequently comes up on the show. Yes, food probably be pretty good. I'd say I would dominate --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fashion.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fashion I would be great at. American political history, but that kind of involves politics.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We got to play within the lines, KG.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What else? Law? Well law, can I have that or is that just too obvious?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I think we're going to allow law. Judges, we're allowing law. Juan, what would be yours? We can actually give you politics because let's be honest, you don't know that much.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The thing is, I know enough to get the answers. But I would say, historical figures, if you could do that, is that political?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, that's good, historical figures.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, you could do historical figures or you could do like --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That involves politics, too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You think that's politics?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: not all historical figures are political.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Judges, we're going to allow it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would like to compete in the, like the high school Jeopardy. I really want to beat those high school kids. I could compete on that level.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's how you are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That makes me feel good. Stay right there. We're going to be back with our final July Fourth thoughts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Now some final thoughts on this Independence Day. We had a lot of questions from our fans. I enjoyed it. Everybody?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes we did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. Are we ready to eat some of these ribs?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I am. Let's start eating.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And thanks to Dinosaur Barbecue. It's delicious, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, thank Dinosaur. That's it for us. We'll see you back here tomorrow. Have a great rest of your holiday. "Hannity" is up next.
